des: Unique Passive - Time: Gains 20 extra Max HP and 4 extra Magic Power every 20s, capped at 15 stacks.

equip.name: Lightning Truncheon
des: Unique Passive - Resonate: Every 6s, the next skill deals 50-1000 extra Magic Damage (scales with Max Mana) to up to 3 enemies.

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Fleeting Time
des: Unique Passive - Timestream: Hero kills or assists reduce the Ultimate's current cooldown by 30%.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: We recommend three equipment sets as below. Vale is a mage with high burst, so the 40% Magic attack bonus of "Holy Crystal" would be a good choice. The Passive of the "Fleeting Time" is a perfect match for the Passive of Vale, which makes it a necessary item for him.

skill.name: Momentum
skill.des:
Leomord gains a 150<font color='#D58E1F'>( +50% Total Physical Attack)</font> shield and begins channeling, slowing enemies in the target direction by 25%. When the channeling is complete or interrupted, he thrusts his sword in the same direction, dealing up to 500<font color='#D58E1F'>( +180% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies hit (scales with channel time) and slowing them by 40% for 1s.
Leomord can cast this skill again to actively interrupt the channeling.
skill.tips: The main DPS skill for human state Leomord takes a long time to charge but could be released early to ensure high hit rate. The shield gained by releasing the skill is surprising useful during a tight match or when Leomord is low in health.

skill.name: Decimation Assault
skill.des: Leomord quickly charge towards a designated direction, dealing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +50% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies near his path and destination and slowing them by 30% for 1s.
skill.tips: Human state skill 2 and mounted state skill 2 are both teleport skills but they don’t share CD. Take advantage of this and Leomord could teleport twice when summoning Barbiel with the ultimate, making it possible to cut into fights quicker.

skill.name: Phantom Steed
skill.des:
Leomord summons <font color='#404495'>(Barbiel)</font> to rush into the battlefield and knock back all enemies in its way, dealing 350<font color='#D58E1F'>( +100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies on the path.
If <font color='#404495'>(Barbiel)</font> comes in contact with Leomord, they will enter a mounted state.
<font color='#404495'>(Mounted State)</font>: Leomord gains a brand-new set of skills. He can cast his Basic Attack in a circular area and even while moving. Additionally, he gains extra 60 Movement Speed and 30 Physical & Magic Defense.
skill.tips: This is the strongest skill of Leomord. Mounting on Barbiel makes him incredibly strong. Barbiel could even knocks back enemies when running. But make sure Leomord comes in contact with Barbiel, otherwise the bonus will not be triggered.

skill.name: The Oath Keeper
skill.des: Leomord's Basic Attacks are guaranteed to critically strike against enemies below 50% Max HP, dealing 200% damage.
skill.tips: Passive effects make it easy for Leomord to finish off low-HP units. Making good use of 2 other skills in the mounted state, and Leomord could cut into fights and reduce enemies’ HP to below 30% and slay them with basic attacks in combination with skill “Inspire”.

item.tips: Skill 1 is the main damage dealing spell of Leomord. So always prioritize upgrading this skill before the ultimate. Skill 2 is the last option.

equip.name: Warrior Boots
des: Unique Passive - Valor: Gains 5 extra Physical Defense for 3s when struck by a Basic Attack, capped at 25.

equip.name: War Axe
des: Unique Passive - Fighting Spirit: Attacks grant 10 extra Physical Attack and 2 extra Physical Penetration for 3s, capped at 8 stacks (the effect is reduced to 3 extra Physical Attack and 1 extra Physical Penetration for Marksmen/Mages/Supports). Gains 15% extra Movement Speed at full stacks.

equip.name: Endless Battle
des: Unique Passive - Divine Justice: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 60% Physical Attack as extra True Damage (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Blade of Despair
des: Unique Passive - Despair: Attacking enemies below 50% HP grants 25% extra Physical Attack for 2s (takes effect before the damage is dealt).

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: This build is focused on dealing high DPS. Rapid Boots provide high mobility so it is useful when you need to either escape or chase. CD Reduction provided by Bloodthirst allows mounted Leomord to cast more spells. Spell Vamp allows him to drain enemies’ HP by using skill 1, making it easier for mounted Leomord to kill. Leomord needs to first cast spells to wear enemies down then kill them with his basic attacks boosted by his passive, thus Blade of Despair makes a great match with his passive. In this combination, Leomord really stands out as real ruthless low-HP targets butcher. In middle game, you are suggested to select among Wings of the Apocalypse Queen, Rose Gold Meteor and Berserker's Fury depending on the situation. Wings of the Apocalypse Queen and Rose Gold Meteor provide good durability while Berserker's Fury plus his passive could deal extremely high damage.

besty.best_mate_tips: Heroes with crowd-control work best with him as they could help create more room for Leomord to deal damage.
besty.name: Minotaur

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Mounted Leomord could deal handsome damage with his combo of spells. Combine the combo with passive effects and basic attacks afterwards, and he could put high pressure to vulnerable classes.
counter.name: Lesley

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Mounted Leomord is highly mobile, but he would still be controlled to death if he rushes into the crowds of enemies willy nilly.
countered_by.name: Kaja

skill.name: Starlight Pulse
skill.des:
Lunox summons a rain of starlight upon nearby enemies, dealing 200<font color='#27C0C7'>( +110% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> and recovering 60<font color='#27C0C7'>( +20% Total Magic Power)</font> HP. The recovering effect doubles when the skill hits enemy heroes. 
Gains one stack of <font color='#404495'>(Power of Order)</font> after use.
skill.tips: The best laning skill in early game. Start the attack with Chaos Assault, then deal damage and heal Lunox with Starlight Pulse, keeping her in Brilliance status all the time.

skill.name: Chaos Assault
skill.des:
Lunox unleashes Chaos Energy forward, dealing <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> equal to 200<font color='#27C0C7'>( +120% Total Magic Power)</font> plus 2.5% of their Max HP to targets hit (when the target is a creep, they take an additional 100% Max HP as damage) and reducing their Movement Speed by 10% for 1s.
Gains one stack of <font color='#404495'>(Power of Chaos)</font> after use.
skill.tips: The attack-oriented skill in laning. Tap to release and it will lock on enemy within target area first. It shares cooldown with Starlight Pulse. You are suggested to use the skill to strike the first 2 attacks in laning.

skill.name: Cosmic Fission
skill.des: When Lunox uses the power of Order and Chaos, she will deal 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +150% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to the targets along the way and slowing them by 40% for 2s.
skill.tips:
Lunox gets the ultimate skill in the Darkening status. When the ultimate skill is on, she could use Chaos Assault with no limit for 4s. Learning how to cast Chaos Assault as many as possible makes you a good Lunox user.
Lunox gets the ultimate skill in Brilliance status. When the skill is on, Lunox is invincible for 3s. The extremely short cast time of the skill could help Lunox escape most directional skills if you are fast enough.

skill.name: Dreamland Twist
skill.des: Lunox has lost the sense of real time and cannot benefit from Cooldown Reduction. When Power of Chaos is enhanced, 80% of her Cooldown Reduction will be converted into <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Penetration)</font>. When Power of Order is enhanced, 120% of her Cooldown Reduction will be converted into Physical and Magic Defense.
skill.tips: Chaos Assault is recommended when there’s advantage in attack, which grants magic PEN for higher damage dealt. Select Starlight Pulse in laning to boost double resist.

item.tips: Prioritize points to Starlight Pulse and Chaos Assault then Cosmic Fission. Always add points to ultimates if possible. Starlight Pulse and Chaos Assault are the main damage dealing skills of Lunox. Add points for them first.

equip.name: Enchanted Talisman
des: Unique Passive - Mana Spring: Regenerates 15% Max Mana every 10s.

equip.name: Demon Shoes
des: Unique Passive - Mysticism: Recovers 10% Max Mana on hero kills or assists and 4% on minion kills.

equip.name: Genius Wand
des: Unique Passive - Magic: Dealing Magic Damage to enemy heroes will reduce their Magic Defense by 3-7 (scales with level) for 2s. Stacks up to 3 times.

equip.name: Concentrated Energy
des: Unique Passive - Recharge: Recovers 10% Max HP on hero kills.

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Blood Wings
des: Unique Passive - Guard: Gains a shield equal to 200% of Magic Power. The shield will regenerate 30s after being damaged, and grants 40 Movement Speed while it lasts.

gear.tips: CD effects provided by Enchanted Talisman greatly boosts passive of Lunox. It also provides bonus magic Pen and defense. Holy Crystal increases her burst, allowing her to deal tons of damage in a short time. Fleeting Time reduces CD of Lunox’s ultimates when she kills or assists, which is important as Lunox is very ultimate-dependent. Lightning Truncheon is important to improve Lunox’s damage dealt as it reduces CD and boosts burst. Blood Wings is the best equipment for Lunox as it makes it possible for her to defend and attack freely. Due to its high price, you are suggested to buy it as the last one of your build.

besty.best_mate_tips: Heroes with control skill are good partners for Lunox
besty.name: Franco

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Power of Chaos: Brilliance makes Lunox less fearful of assassins. He could deal with assassins’ counters quite well.
counter.name: Lancelot

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Lunox could only protect herself for a short moment. Stable damage dealer with ability to blink are great threats to her.
countered_by.name: Martis

skill.name: Ninjutsu: Demon Feast
skill.des:
Every 5 basic attacks by Hanzo <font color='#404495'>(temporarily unlocks)</font> this ability for 6.5s.
Hanzo uses Ame no Habakiri to devour a target and digest them over a period of time. By doing so Hanzo gets 10 <font color='#404495'>(Demon Blood)</font>. (Can only be used against Minions and Creeps. Targeting Lord or Turtle deals 500 <font color='#E5CB19'>(True Damage)</font>).
skill.tips: This skill provides powerful jungling ability for Hanzo. If the Attack Speed is fast enough, each attack of Hanzo can unlock two stacks.

skill.name: Ninjutsu: Soul Reap
skill.des:
Hanzo summons demonic spikes at the target location, dealing 160<font color='#D58E1F'>( +60% Total Physical Attack)</font> immediate <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>.
If an enemy is hit, the skill will strike again after 0.5 s, dealing 40<font color='#D58E1F'>( +15% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to targets in the area and slowing them by 40% until no target is hit or dealing additional damage for 8 times.
Every unit hit grants him 1 <font color='#404495'>(Demon Blood)</font>.
skill.tips: This skill ensures the laning ability of Hanzo, try to make full use of it when Hanzo takes back the area in order to obtain Demon Blood faster

skill.name: Kinjutsu: Pinnacle Ninja
skill.des:
Hanzo gains 25 Demon Blood and charges into battle as Demon Pneuma, gaining a new set of basic skills while leaving his body behind.
<font color='#404495'>(Demon Pneuma)</font> consumes 10 <font color='#404495'>(Demon Blood)</font> every second, and when it is depleted, Hanzo returns to his body's original position. While in Demon Pneuma form, it can move through terrains and has additional 35% Movement Speed and 30% Attack Speed, but its Physical and Magic Defense are reduced by 50.0%.
When <font color='#404495'>(Demon Pneuma)</font> is killed, it will be drawn back to Hanzo's body, stunning him for 3s and weakening him for 8s (slowed by 55%, Physical and Magic Defense reduced by 100% and location revealed); they are both killed if <font color='#404495'>(the body)</font> is destroyed.
<font color='#404495'>(Choice)</font>: Demon Pneuma returns to Hanzo's body immediately, or the other way around.
skill.tips: Try to hide Hanzo's body in the safe area. When facing Hanzo, to find his body and kill him is also a good way to counter him.

skill.name: Ame no Habakiri
skill.des:
Hanzo When units are eliminated nearby, the Blood Demon absorbs their souls into its body into <font color='#404495'>(Demon Blood)</font>.
Hanzo gains 2 <font color='#404495'>(Demon Blood)</font> for each non-hero on death and 20 <font color='#404495'>(Demon Blood)</font> if it's a hero.
skill.tips: Even when Hanzo is in a defensive status, he can also recover Demon Blood depending on his Passive. The sufficiency of Demon Blood is a must for Hanzo to perform attack or escape.

item.tips: This skill provides powerful jungling ability for Hanzo

equip.name: Blade of the Heptaseas
des: Unique Passive - Ambush: If no damage is dealt to or taken from enemy heroes within 5s, the next Basic Attack deals 160 plus 40% Physical Attack as extra Physical Damage and slows the target by 40% for 1.5s.

equip.name: Ice Hunter's Swift Boots
des: Unique Passive - Hunter: After dealing damage to a Creep, deal <2|lv 2> + <1005 0.02> True Damage to the target over 3s (damage is increased by 100% for non-Marksmen heroes).

equip.name: Hunter Strike
des: Unique Passive - Retribution: Dealing damage to the same enemy hero or creep 5 times in a row grants 50% extra Movement Speed that decays over 3s (8s cooldown).

equip.name: Endless Battle
des: Unique Passive - Divine Justice: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 60% Physical Attack as extra True Damage (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Blade of Despair
des: Unique Passive - Despair: Attacking enemies below 50% HP grants 25% extra Physical Attack for 2s (takes effect before the damage is dealt).

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: We recommend these three sets of euipment items, Among which the third set is highly recommended as Hanzo has a good ability of farming in the jungle with his skills and the third set improves his ability to gank.

skill.name: Ancient Seed
skill.des:
Belerick releases vines in a designated direction, dealing 200<font color='#27C0C7'>( +50% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies along the path and slowing them by 25%. Ancient Seeds left by the vines will erupt into thorns after 1s, dealing 200<font color='#27C0C7'>( +50% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies on the path and taunting them for 1.2s.
Deals 80% extra damage against Minions.
skill.tips: The skill is the major reason why Belerick is a strong laning hero. In a teamfight, by inflicting Nature’s Seed on enemy heroes, Belerick is able to kill enemy core heroes sooner than ever.

skill.name: Nature's Strike
skill.des:
Belerick increases his Movement Speed by 80% and enhances his next Basic Attack. (The Movement Speed gain will decay in 2s.)
This enhanced Basic Attack deals 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +60% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> and slows the target by 60% for 1.4s. Belerick also recovers HP equal to 240 plus 10% of his lost HP.
Each time Deadly Thorns is triggered, reduce the cooldown of this skill by 1s.
skill.tips: With his strong ability to recover, Belerick is a strong laning and teamfight hero. With Brave Smite Belerick gets even harder to kill.

skill.name: Wrath of Dryad
skill.des: Belerick conjures spreading vines around him, dealing 100<font color='#27C0C7'>( +30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies in the area 4 times and taunting them for 1.5s.
skill.tips: Even without aliies around, Belerick's durability can be secured with 10% Recovery and 40% DMG Reduction. So don't hesitate to use it when necessary.

skill.name: Deadly Thorns
skill.des:
For every 50 damage inflicted upon Belerick, he has a 25% chance to shoot the nearest enemy unit, dealing <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> equal to 55(+5*Hero Level) plus 1.8% of his Max HP (scales with level). In each 0.4s, this attack can be triggered once only.
His HP obtained from Equipment and Emblems is increased by 30%.
skill.tips: For Belerick, it is a passive as much as a DPS skill. Using the 1st skill, Belerick is able to control where to cast the passive. The 2nd skill is sure to trigger his passive. Players can utilize the combo to make Belerick a strong hero when laning.

item.tips: Main the 2nd skill. Upgrage the Ultimate when possible. Then the 1st skill.

equip.name: Cursed Helmet
des: Unique Passive - Burning Soul: Deals Magic Damage equal to 0.8% of the hero's Max HP per second to nearby enemies. This damage is increased by 210% to 350% against creeps and minions (scales with level).

equip.name: Demon Shoes
des: Unique Passive - Mysticism: Recovers 10% Max Mana on hero kills or assists and 4% on minion kills.

equip.name: Twilight Armor
des: Unique Passive - Twilight: Every 1.5s, the next attack deals 35 plus 5% extra HP as extra Magic Damage.

equip.name: Thunder Belt
des: Unique Passive - Thunderbolt: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 50 plus 5% of the hero's extra HP as extra True Damage to the target and enemies around them and slows them by 40%-80% (scales with the hero's extra HP) for 1s (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Blade Armor
des: Unique Passive - Bladed Armor: When struck by a Basic Attack, deals Physical Damage equal to 20% of the incoming damage (calculated before Damage Reduction) plus 20% of the hero's Physical Defense to the attacker and slows them by 15% for 1s.

equip.name: Oracle
des: Unique Passive - Bless: Received Shield and HP Regen effects are increased by 30%.

gear.tips: Belerick's Passive - Flower of Life deals AoE DMG so that it is easy to use it to get assists. So Wizard Boots should be a good choice as his first equipment item. Then we should go for Oracle and Sky Guardian Helmet. Oracle's passive works perfect with Belerick's Power of Nature, also with the help from Brave Smite, Belerick could recover a lot of HP. The 2 items also increase his max HP a lot and boost the damage of Flower of Life. In the middle of matches we could choose Cursed Helmet to improve his laning efficiency. Since the items listed above provide a lot of HP, we should also go for Twilight Armor and Wings of the Apocalypse Queen to counter the damage from heroes with high DPS. In general, the set improve his ability to recover and to deal damage by increasing HP. And by utilizing Twilight Armor and Wings of the Apocalypse Queen and Belerick's ultimate, he will be able to counter high DPS heroes.

besty.best_mate_tips: DPS heroes with recovery ability are the perfect matches with Belerick, since they add to Belerick's durability, so he can deal more damage.
besty.name: Rafaela

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Belerick is a squishy killer. Do not retreat when using Belerick and just rush to the enemy suqishy heroes face.If those heroes run away, then you're half way to victory.
counter.name: Miya

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Belerick is vulnerable against the heroes that could deal a high amount of damage. His passive won't help that much when facing these kinds of heroes, for he won't have the time to convert his passive into damage.
countered_by.name: Gusion

skill.name: Energy Transformation
skill.des:
<font color='#404495'>(Hold)</font>: Kimmy continuously shoots Chemical Bolts in the target direction, each bolt consuming 5 energy and dealing 30<font color='#D58E1F'>( +23% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+25% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to the enemy hit. Chemical Bolts that fail to hit an enemy will explode at the end of their path, dealing the same amount of damage to nearby enemies.
The Chemical Bolts can critically strike, but only benefit from 40% of Kimmy's Spell Vamp.
skill.tips: Use 1st skill to attack enemies at a long distance. When enemies are around you, attack as many enemies as possible.

skill.name: Chemical Refinement
skill.des:
Kimmy shoots out enhanced Chemical Spray and recoils in the opposite direction. Enemies that come into contact with the Spray left on the path will take 14<font color='#D58E1F'>( +30% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+40% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> every 0.5s and be slowed by 40% for 4s.
Kimmy also restores 30 energy upon casting this skill.
skill.tips: When chased after by enemies, use 2nd skill to slow them down.

skill.name: Maximum Charge
skill.des:
After a period of charging, Kimmy launches a Luminous Chemical Attack in a designated direction. The projectile will explode upon hitting an enemy or reaching the maximum range, dealing 130<font color='#D58E1F'>( +100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+115% Total Magic Power)</font>-238<font color='#D58E1F'>( +185% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+211% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to the primary target (scales with charging time) and 83% damage to nearby enemies.
Kimmy restores 30 energy if this skill hits an enemy.
skill.tips: 3rd skill is of long range. When enemies intend to attack you, you can target them in advance; when enemies try to run away, use it to reap them.

skill.name: Chemist's Instinct
skill.des:
Kimmy can move and aim in different directions when using her Spray Gun, but is often less accurate. Kimmy's Spray Gun attack restores 5 energy on hit and deals <font color='#D58E1F'>( +22% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+24% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> per bullet. Each bullet can inherit up to 115% of her Attack Effects (scales with level), but only benefits from 75% of her <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Lifesteal)</font>.
Kimmy will not stop moving when shooting and cannot gain extra Attack Speed, and will convert every 10% Attack Speed she receives into 5 Movement Speed. Kimmy restores 15 energy each time she kills an enemy.
skill.tips: Kimmy is still in movement while using skills. Keep the distance from enemies and attack them at the same time.

item.tips: Max 1st skill, then 2nd skill. Level up Ult when possible. 1st skill is the core damage dealing skill of Kimmy, so level it up first.

equip.name: Genius Wand
des: Unique Passive - Magic: Dealing Magic Damage to enemy heroes will reduce their Magic Defense by 3-7 (scales with level) for 2s. Stacks up to 3 times.

equip.name: Ice Queen Wand
des: Unique Passive - Ice Bound: Skills slow the target by 15% for 3s, capped at 2 stacks.

equip.name: Concentrated Energy
des: Unique Passive - Recharge: Recovers 10% Max HP on hero kills.

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Blood Wings
des: Unique Passive - Guard: Gains a shield equal to 200% of Magic Power. The shield will regenerate 30s after being damaged, and grants 40 Movement Speed while it lasts.

gear.tips: Kimmy's 1st skill Energy Transformation deals the most part of Damage. Bloodlust Axe provides high Spell Vamp effect; the slowing down effect of Corrosion Scythe enhances hit rate of skills. Arcane Boots boost magic penetration and increase Damage: Kimmy's skills are more likely to trigger Passive of Hunter Strike, and the higher level of movement makes it easier for her to chase or run away from enemies. Blade of Despair can increase Damage to the most. The last equipment depends on conditions: one more Blade of Despair or Dreadnaught Armor are all good chioce.

besty.best_mate_tips: Heroes with CC are all good teammates.
besty.name: Kaja

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Counters heroes with low mobility.
counter.name: Valir

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Countered by heroes with high mobility and strong CC.
countered_by.name: Lancelot

skill.name: Molten Scythes
skill.des:
Thamuz tosses <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font> in the target direction. After travelling for a certain distance or hitting the first enemy hero, they deal 120<font color='#D58E1F'>( +60% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>. The <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font> will then slow nearby enemies by 30% and deal 45<font color='#D58E1F'>( +20% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> every 0.5s.
After leaving Thamuz for a period of time or a certain distance, the <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font> will return to Thamuz and drag enemies in their path to him. Thamuz can approach the scythes or cast the skill again to retrieve them.
skill.tips: Thamuz's core skill. Approach the enemies with the speed boost after throwing the scythes and attack them with the enhanced attack. Retrieveing the scythes can also enhance his attack.

skill.name: Chasm Trample
skill.des:
Thamuz jumps to a designated area to deal 230<font color='#D58E1F'>( +60% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> and slow the enemy units by 25% for 2s upon landing. 
If the scythes are still travelling, they will return to Thamuz and <font color='#404495'>(Molten Scythes)</font> will reset its CD instantly.
skill.tips: Use this skill to retrieve the scythes, collect the scythes, dash into the enemies or land on the path of the enemies to retrieve the scythes as well as pull enemies back to Thamuz.

skill.name: Cauterant Inferno
skill.des:
Thamuz spouts the lava stored in his body, dealing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +80% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to nearby enemies and creating a <font color='#404495'>(Cauterant Zone)</font> around him. The <font color='#404495'>(Cauterant Zone)</font> lasts 9s and deals 30<font color='#D58E1F'>( +10% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> every 0.5s to enemies in the area.
Meanwhile, Thamuz gains 500 extra Max HP, heals himself by the same amount, and increases his Attack Speed by 1.3 times. He also recovers 1.5% Max HP each time he deals damage with Basic Attacks or his <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font>.
skill.tips: Regenerates a huge amount of HP in team fight by using this skill

skill.name: Grand Lord Lava
skill.des:
When Thamuz is holding his <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font>, his each Basic Attack has a chance to conjure a burst of Lava Energy beneath the target that erupts after a 0.7s delay, dealing 50<font color='#E5CB19'>( +110% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#E5CB19'>(True Damage)</font>.
When without <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font>, Thamuz gains 25% extra Movement Speed and will enhance his next Basic Attack after retrieving the <font color='#404495'>(Scythes)</font>. The enhanced Basic Attack slows the target by 30% and is guaranteed to trigger Lava Energy.
skill.tips: Deal more damage by triggering more puddles of lava in an area where enemies are concentrating.

item.tips: Main skill 1,then Skill 2. Upgrade the ultimate when possible

equip.name: Corrosion Scythe
des: Unique Passive - Corrosion: Basic Attacks gain 80 extra Physical Damage and slow the target by 8% (halved for ranged Basic Attacks) for 1.5s. Stacks up to 5 times.

equip.name: Warrior Boots
des: Unique Passive - Valor: Gains 5 extra Physical Defense for 3s when struck by a Basic Attack, capped at 25.

equip.name: War Axe
des: Unique Passive - Fighting Spirit: Attacks grant 10 extra Physical Attack and 2 extra Physical Penetration for 3s, capped at 8 stacks (the effect is reduced to 3 extra Physical Attack and 1 extra Physical Penetration for Marksmen/Mages/Supports). Gains 15% extra Movement Speed at full stacks.

equip.name: Cursed Helmet
des: Unique Passive - Burning Soul: Deals Magic Damage equal to 0.8% of the hero's Max HP per second to nearby enemies. This damage is increased by 210% to 350% against creeps and minions (scales with level).

equip.name: Oracle
des: Unique Passive - Bless: Received Shield and HP Regen effects are increased by 30%.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: When equipping Thunder Belt, Thamuz can utilize the CD of Slaughterous Scythes to trigger the bonus damage. Also the slow effect Thunder Belt has to offer helps him to hit more enemies with the lava puddle. Oracle increases his regeneration and because of Thamuz needs to release his skill frequently, the effect of Brutal Force Breastplate stacks up quickly, so he will be greatly enhanced. Wings of the Apocalypse Queen increases his attack in a more sustainable way. For the las equipment item, he could use  Immortality. Or when he needs more damage, he could use Blade of Despair and Corrosion Scythe.

besty.best_mate_tips: Both group control and immune control can greatly enhance their characteristics.
besty.name: Angela

counter.restrain_hero_tips: The lack of displacement of the continuous damage heroes in the face of thamuz's pursuit of lack of response.
counter.name: Miya

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Both physical attack immunity and forced displacement pose a very high threat to thamuz
countered_by.name: Minotaur

skill.name: Synchro Fission
skill.des: Harith creates a phantom of himself in a distant location. Harith and his phantom will then release <font color='#404495'>(Synchro Fission)</font> toward each other, dealing 236<font color='#27C0C7'>( +84% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to all enemy units on the path. When the 2 energy waves collide, an explosion occurs, dealing 590<font color='#27C0C7'>( +210% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to all enemies in the explosion area.
skill.tips: Try to keep enemy units in the explosion range, which causes huge damage to them.

skill.name: Chrono Dash
skill.des: Harith dashes towards the designated direction. When arrives, he steals Magic Power of nearby enemy heroes, generates a shield that absorbs at least 185<font color='#27C0C7'>( +140% Total Magic Power)</font> damage and enhance the next Basic Attack. Harith's enhanced Basic Attack deals 225<font color='#27C0C7'>( +100% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> and slows enemies by 40%. Hitting an enemy with Harith's enhanced Basic Attack reduces the CD of the next <font color='#404495'>(Chrono Dash)</font> by 3s.
skill.tips: Make sure Harith dashes to the correct direction. With the shield to be gained after the dash, Harith should be able to take less damage than he is suppoesed to be.

skill.name: Zaman Force
skill.des:
Harith uses his Key to summon the Zaman Force. When the multidimensional rift appears, the CD of <font color='#404495'>(Chrono Dash)</font> is reduced by 4s. The rift initially slows enemies in range by 35%, and continually slows enemies by 35%.
If Harith comes into contact with the rift when using <font color='#404495'>(Chrono Dash)</font>, he will absorb the energy within it, so as to reduce the CD of <font color='#404495'>(Synchro Fission)</font>/<font color='#404495'>(Chrono Dash)</font> by 1s/3s respectively.
skill.tips: After using "Synchro Fission", make sure to pass through rifts every time using Chrono Dash. It enables Harith to use the "Chrono Dash" skill infinitely within the duration.

skill.name: Key Insight
skill.des: Harith gains insight from his Key. He immediately reduces its time controlled up to 45% (dependent on the number of nearby enemy heroes).
skill.tips: This skill can minimize the debuffs when being controlled, so his survivability is ensured.

item.tips: Harith has two suitable Skill Build sets. If you choose magic equipment items, build 1st skill to the most and level up ult when possible. If you emphasize more on equipment effect, build 2nd skill to the most and level up ult when possible.

equip.name: Enchanted Talisman
des: Unique Passive - Mana Spring: Regenerates 15% Max Mana every 10s.

equip.name: Calamity Reaper
des: Unique Passive - Calamity: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 120% Magic Power as extra True Damage and grants 10% extra Movement Speed (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Feather of Heaven
des: Unique Passive - Affliction: Basic Attacks deal extra Magic Damage equal to 50 plus 30% of the hero's Magic Power.

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: Sufficient CD reduction ensures that Harith can use the Chrono Dash skill infinitely during the Zaman Force skill time, so the Calamity Reaper is recommended as the first equipment item, which provides the Mana Regen and CD reduction, and the Passive effect of it is a perfect match with the Chrono Dash. Then Harith needs the Magic Shoes and the Enchanted Talisman, which can build the CD reduction to the fullest, and the Mana Regen effect drives out the worry of running out of Mana. Then we recommend the Ice Queen Wand and the Concentrated Energy. The Spell Vamp provided by these two pieces of equipment can ensures Harris with a strong endurance. The last piece of equipment can be adjusted according to the actual battlefield situation: Blood Wings, Winter Truncheon and Divine Glaive are all good choice.

besty.best_mate_tips: With the help of strong CC heroes, Harith can better deal damage.
besty.name: Gatotkaca

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Counters Heroes without burst damage and high HP.
counter.name: Layla

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Still as a fragile mage, Harith is countered by heroes with strong CC.
countered_by.name: Kaja

skill.name: Spear of Glory
skill.des: Minsitthar thrusts forward with the Spear of Glory and stuns enemies hit by the tip of the spear. After a short delay, Minsitthar pulls back the spear, dealing 175<font color='#D58E1F'>( +180% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to all enemies along the way and pulling them in front of him.
skill.tips: Try to better use this skill and pull back the back-line heroes who are easy to slay even when they're hiding behind the tanks.

skill.name: Shield Assault
skill.des: Minsitthar awakens the power in his shield and releases it, dealing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +160% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to all enemies in a rectangular area and slowing them by 80% (decaying rapidly over 2s). Meanwhile, he enters <font color='#404495'>(Phalanx)</font> state for 3s, reducing damage taken from the front by 25% and enhancing his Basic Attack to swiftly strike an area in front of him.
skill.tips: The range of this skill is not too wide so better use it together with his 1st Skill, and by doing so the hit rate will be increased.

skill.name: King's Calling
skill.des:
Minsitthar charges forward and calls 4 Royal Guards to form a field around him. The Royal Guards cannot move but will attack enemies in the field for <font color='#D58E1F'>( +40% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>.
Enemies in the field are slowed by 20% and cannot use movement skills.
skill.tips: Use the Ult directly when a teamfight with fewer than 3 players occurs. When facing more enemies, use "Spear of Glory" first and fast slay an ememy hero to increase the chances of winning the teamfight.

skill.name: Mark of the King
skill.des: Minsitthar's Basic Attacks and skills apply a stack of <font color='#404495'>(Mark of the King)</font>, up to 5 stacks. Upon reaching max stacks, the next attack detonates all <font color='#404495'>(Mark of the King)</font> stacks, dealing <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> equal to 300<font color='#47BE34'>( +6% Total HP)</font> of Minsitthar's Max HP and stunning the target for 0.8s while healing Minsitthar for 300<font color='#47BE34'>( +6% Total HP)</font> HP. Can only trigger once every 8s on the same target.
skill.tips: With this passive, Minsithar can perform more ganks with his teammates without the worry of  his farming falling behind.

item.tips: Build 1st Skill to the most and then 2nd Skill. Build Ult when possible.

equip.name: Demon Hunter Sword
des: Unique Passive - Devour: Basic Attacks deal 9% of the target's current HP as extra Physical Damage (capped at 60 against minions).

equip.name: Tough Boots
des: Unique Passive - Fortitude: CC and Slow Duration reduced by 30%

equip.name: Corrosion Scythe
des: Unique Passive - Corrosion: Basic Attacks gain 80 extra Physical Damage and slow the target by 8% (halved for ranged Basic Attacks) for 1.5s. Stacks up to 5 times.

equip.name: Thunder Belt
des: Unique Passive - Thunderbolt: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 50 plus 5% of the hero's extra HP as extra True Damage to the target and enemies around them and slows them by 40%-80% (scales with the hero's extra HP) for 1s (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Athena's Shield
des: Unique Passive - Shield: Upon taking Magic Damage, gains 25% Magic Damage Reduction for 3s (applied before taking damage). Regains this effect 5s after leaving combat.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: Minsitthar's ultimate will expose him to the enemies so being more tanky is highly recommended.  Bloodlust Axe, Warrior Boots, Endless Battle and Thunder Belt all increase the damage of his 1st and 2nd skills as well as his survivability. For the 5th item, we recommend Blade of Despair which ensures Minsitthar to have a strong damage-dealing combo. The last item can be chosen among Immortality, Rose Gold Meteor, and Corrosion Scythe depending on the situation.

besty.best_mate_tips: Heroes with high burst damage can cooperate well with his Ult.
besty.name: Hanabi

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Minsitthar's Ult can perform a "Grounded" effect and counters those who are good at blink skills.
counter.name: Harith

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Minsitthar is countred by heroes with high burst.
countered_by.name: Lunox

skill.name: Ocean Oddity
skill.des:
Kadita summons an ocean wave to carry her in the target direction and then back (ignores terrain), dealing 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +90% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies along the way and slowing them by 30%. She gains Control Immunity and 50% extra Damage Reduction when inside the wave.
<font color='#404495'>(Use Again)</font>: Kadita leaves the wave without interrupting the wave's movement.
skill.tips: During this process, use the 2nd skill and Ultimate and surround enemies with her waves.

skill.name: Breath of the Ocean
skill.des:
After a short delay, Kadita summons an ocean wave to erupt at the target location, dealing 350<font color='#27C0C7'>( +140% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies hit and knocking them airborne for 1.5s.
Kadita can cast this skill during <font color='#404495'>(Ocean Oddity)</font> to summon an ocean wave beneath her with a shorter eruption delay.
skill.tips: It's a skill that takes time to reach a strong effect and needs proper prediction and teammate's cooperation. If you manage to knock an enemy hero up, use Kadita’s 1st skill or her ultimate to eliminate them.

skill.name: Rough Waves
skill.des:
Kadita dives into the ground and sends ocean waves in all directions, each dealing 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +60% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies hit and slowing them by 30%. Enemies hit by multiple waves take increased damage. The waves then return to Kadita, each dealing 200<font color='#27C0C7'>( +40% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies along the way. Enemies hit by multiple returning waves take less damage after the first hit.
When underground, Kadita is untargetable and gains 60% extra Movement Speed.
skill.tips: The high AOE burst damage and her invulnerable state make her one of the best in teamfights.

skill.name: Thalassophobia
skill.des: Kadita gains the <font color='#404495'>(Blessing of the Ocean)</font> every 30s. The Blessing is triggered when she takes damage from enemy heroes and lasts 4s, allowing her to recover 65% of the HP lost within the duration afterward.
skill.tips: Use her 1st skill when the passive is stacked and poke enemies while taking no damage.

item.tips: During this process, use the 2nd skill and Ultimate and surround enemies with her waves.

equip.name: Clock of Destiny
des: Unique Passive - Time: Gains 20 extra Max HP and 4 extra Magic Power every 20s, capped at 15 stacks.

equip.name: Demon Shoes
des: Unique Passive - Mysticism: Recovers 10% Max Mana on hero kills or assists and 4% on minion kills.

equip.name: Lightning Truncheon
des: Unique Passive - Resonate: Every 6s, the next skill deals 50-1000 extra Magic Damage (scales with Max Mana) to up to 3 enemies.

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Fleeting Time
des: Unique Passive - Timestream: Hero kills or assists reduce the Ultimate's current cooldown by 30%.

equip.name: Blood Wings
des: Unique Passive - Guard: Gains a shield equal to 200% of Magic Power. The shield will regenerate 30s after being damaged, and grants 40 Movement Speed while it lasts.

gear.tips: Burst: With this set of equipment items, Kadita lays more emphasis on high burst damage. So the Lightning Truncheon and the Demon Shoes are a good choice for the first two items, providing high damage and ability to deal continuous damage. The Fleeting Time provides CD reduction, and the Concentrated Energy ensures the survival of Kadita in teamfights because it provides with HP and Magical Lifesteal. The Divine Glaive provides a great lot of Magic Penetration to deal high damage to those enemy heroes with high magical defense. The Blood Wings is the final recommended item for Kadita as it ensures survival and provides high magic attack.

skill.name: Shadow Stampede
skill.des:
Faramis enters the Shadow state for 3s, gaining 70% extra Movement Speed, 50 extra Physical & Magic Defense, 20% cooldown reduction of this skill, and the ability to move through terrain. Enemy heroes that come into contact with Faramis in this state are dealt 250<font color='#27C0C7'>( +60% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> and applied with a <font color='#404495'>(Nether Mark)</font>. Upon leaving the Shadow state, Faramis drags all the marked enemy heroes toward him, dealing 250<font color='#27C0C7'>( +60% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font>. Use Again: Faramis leaves the Shadow state early and drags marked enemies toward him.
The range of soul fragment absorption is increased while this skill is active.
skill.tips: A skill used to start a team fight. Cast this skill with Flicker or Sprint. Join the battle and stack advantages.

skill.name: Ghost Bursters
skill.des: Faramis gathers Nether energy in a fan-shaped area ahead, dealing 330<font color='#27C0C7'>( +144% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to enemies within. The energy will then split and bounce to nearby enemies, dealing 200<font color='#27C0C7'>( +72% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> (splits up to 3 times on enemy hero hits and 1 time on non-enemy hero hits).
skill.tips: Core damage skill. The outburst can split so use this skill when there are multiple enemy units. With Shadow Stampede, Faramis can pull multiple targets together and deal high split damage.

skill.name: Cult Altar
skill.des: Faramis turns his surroundings into the <font color='#404495'>(Nether Realm)</font> for 6s, making affected allied heroes (including himself) enter the <font color='#404495'>(Specter)</font> state and granting them 600 plus 10<font color='#27C0C7'>( +5% Total Magic Power)</font>% extra HP and 50% extra Movement Speed for 1s. When the <font color='#404495'>(Specter)</font> state breaks, the hero will clear all debuffs and enter a brief Resurrection state for 1.3s. An allied hero's <font color='#404495'>(Specter)</font> state ends when they leave the <font color='#404495'>(Nether Realm)</font>.
skill.tips: Good choice for team fights. Cast this skill no matter who is dying to protect teammates and himself. Faramis and his teammates can also deal great damage during this time.

skill.name: Vicious Retrieval
skill.des: Every 4s, Faramis' next skill against enemy heroes and summoned objects generates a soul fragment on the spot. Faramis can absorb the soul fragment to restore 100<font color='#27C0C7'>( +50% Total Magic Power)</font> HP and gain 2 extra Magic Power (up to 40 stacks). Upon death, he consumes the absorbed soul fragments to reduce the respawn timer, each reducing the timer by 3% (up to 90%). Enemies that die around Faramis also have a chance to drop soul fragments.
skill.tips: The main regeneration skill for Faramis. He can collect souls nearby to restore himself. Meanwhile, the souls he collects will shorten the time of his next respawn so that he can come back to the battlefield quickly.

item.tips: Upgrade Skill 2 first. When you got the Ultimate, upgrade it first. Upgrade Skill 1 at last.

equip.name: Enchanted Talisman
des: Unique Passive - Mana Spring: Regenerates 15% Max Mana every 10s.

equip.name: Magic Shoes - Conceal
des: Active Skill - Conceal: Success

equip.name: Fleeting Time
des: Unique Passive - Timestream: Hero kills or assists reduce the Ultimate's current cooldown by 30%.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

equip.name: Antique Cuirass
des: Unique Passive - Deter: When struck by a skill, reduces the attacker's Physical Attack by 5% for 2s, capped at 3 stacks.

equip.name: Athena's Shield
des: Unique Passive - Shield: Upon taking Magic Damage, gains 25% Magic Damage Reduction for 3s (applied before taking damage). Regains this effect 5s after leaving combat.

gear.tips: We recommend this set of Equipment items. Since Faramis is a support and mage hero with poke ability, we choose the set of Equipment that provides both survival and damage.

skill.name: Fist Wind
skill.des:
Badang unleashes a gust of <font color='#404495'>(Fist Wind)</font> in the target direction, dealing 160<font color='#D58E1F'>( +90% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies hit, slowing them by 30% for 1.5s, and knocking them back. The <font color='#404495'>(Fist Wind)</font> will explode upon hitting an obstacle, dealing 120<font color='#D58E1F'>( +60% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to nearby enemies. <font color='#404495'>(Fist Wind)</font> can trigger attack effects and grants Badang 1 <font color='#404495'>(Chivalry Fist)</font> stack upon cast.
Badang stores up to 2 <font color='#404495'>(Fist Wind)</font> charges and restores 1 charge every 11.0s.
skill.tips: Try to use Qigong Fist and trigger Passive and control enemies at some important moments.

skill.name: Fist Break
skill.des:
Badang dashes in the target direction, dealing 230<font color='#D58E1F'>( +50% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies in his path while gaining a 350<font color='#D58E1F'>( +150% Total Physical Attack)</font> shield that lasts 5s. He stops immediately upon hitting an enemy hero, slightly knocking them back while creating an obstacle that lasts 4s behind them. Enemies hit by the obstacle are dealt 130<font color='#D58E1F'>( +30% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>.
<font color='#404495'>(Use Again)</font>: Badang removes the obstacle he created.
skill.tips: This skill can be stacked. It's Badang's core skill. Try to better use Qigong Fist and slow enemies down to increase the hit rate of Fist Break. With the help of the obstacles, his Passive can deal more damage and better control the enemies.

skill.name: Fist Crack
skill.des:
Badang throws a flurry of punches in the target direction, dealing 80<font color='#D58E1F'>( +54% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies hit multiple times (can trigger attack effects). The <font color='#404495'>(Fist Wind)</font> generated by the punches will explode upon hitting an obstacle, dealing 40<font color='#D58E1F'>( +27% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to nearby enemies.
Badang is immune to control effects for the duration.
skill.tips: Fist Crack's fist wind can trigger the explosion of his Passive.

skill.name: Chivalry Fist
skill.des:
After every 4 Basic Attacks, Badang's next Basic Attack deals 50<font color='#D58E1F'>( +30% Total Physical Attack)</font> extra <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies hit and knocks them back. Enemies that are knocked into obstacles will be stunned for 0.8s (minions and creeps are stunned directly).
<font color='#404495'>(Fist Wind)</font> generated by Badang's skills can also trigger this effect.
skill.tips: Better use the control effect with Fist Break and slay enemies with ease.

item.tips: Build Qigong Fist first. Build Ult when possible.

equip.name: Demon Hunter Sword
des: Unique Passive - Devour: Basic Attacks deal 9% of the target's current HP as extra Physical Damage (capped at 60 against minions).

equip.name: Warrior Boots
des: Unique Passive - Valor: Gains 5 extra Physical Defense for 3s when struck by a Basic Attack, capped at 25.

equip.name: Golden Staff
des: Unique Passive - Swift: Every 1% extra Crit Chance gained is converted into 1% extra Attack Speed.

equip.name: Oracle
des: Unique Passive - Bless: Received Shield and HP Regen effects are increased by 30%.

equip.name: Malefic Roar
des: Unique Passive - Armor Buster: When attacking an enemy, gains 0.05% extra Physical Penetration for each point of the enemy's Physical Defense, capped at 20%.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: The first equipment set is highly recommended. Haas's Claws provides HP Regen, and the Passive effects of Endless Battle suit Badang's Qigong fist very well. Wings of the Apocalypse Queen and Immortality ensures Badang's survival ability in teamfights. Blade of Despair greatly enhances Badang's attack in the late game.

skill.name: Tyrant's Revenge
skill.des: Khufra pulls the bandage on his arms to launch himself in the specified direction, dealing <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> equal to 50 plus 7<font color='#D58E1F'>( <1022 0.015 1>)</font>% of his Max HP to all enemy units on the path. When blinking to the furthest distance or encountering a first enemy hero, Khufra will immediately stop, dealing <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> equal to 50 plus 7<font color='#D58E1F'>( <1022 0.015 1>)</font>% of his Max HP to enemies nearby and then knocking them in the air for up to 1.1s.
skill.tips: It's the main skill for Khufra to join the battle. The longer he charges, the longer the knock-up effect will be. Try to better use it with ultimate "Tyrant's Rage" and control enemy heroes much longer.

skill.name: Bouncing Ball
skill.des:
Khufra uses bandage to wrap himself into a magic bouncing ball, increasing his own Physical & Magic Defense by 30%. Enemies trying to use blink skills to move across Khufra will be knocked airborne. 
Each time the magic bouncing ball hits the ground, it will deal <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> equal to 50 plus 3<font color='#D58E1F'>( <1022 0.02 1>)</font>% of his Max HP to enemies nearby and slow them by 80%. Lasts 0.2s.
skill.tips: Each time the magical bouncing ball hits the ground, it will deal Magic Damage to enemies nearby and reduce their movement speed. This skill counters the heroes that are good at blink skills - they can not move across the bouncing ball.

skill.name: Tyrant's Rage
skill.des: Khufra pulls back all enemy targets around him toward his front, dealing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> and slowing them down for 1.25s. If the enemies are knocked against walls, extra <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> equal to 150% of this skill's damage will be inflicted upon them, and they will be stunned, instead of slowed.
skill.tips: Needs practice to well use this skill. Better use it with 1st skill and it would be easier for Khufra to deal huge damage and control enemies for a long time.

skill.name: Spell Curse
skill.des:
Khufra activates the Spell Curse left by Esmeralda every 12s, enhancing his next Basic Attack. The enhanced Basic Attack gains extra attack range and deals <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> equal to <font color='#D58E1F'>( +120% Total Physical Attack)</font> plus 6% of the target's Max HP. Also slows the target by 30% for 1.5s and heals Khufra by 8% of his Max HP on hit.
Each time Khufra applies a control effect to an enemy hero with his skill, the cooldown of <font color='#404495'>(Spell Curse)</font> is reduced by 4s.
skill.tips: It's the only recover skill of Khufra. The enhanced basic attack grants him strong poke abilities. It's smart strategies to use the skill and trigger passive twice in a short time and restore much HP.

item.tips: Khufra has two skill build sets. Set 1 - Build 1st skill first and build Ult when possible. This set helps provide more frequent control effects and makes it easier for teammates to win the teamfights. Set 2 - Build 2nd skill first and build Ult when possible. This set is suitable for those who prefer to fight alone and increases the chances to slay the enemy heroes that are easy to kill.

equip.name: Cursed Helmet
des: Unique Passive - Burning Soul: Deals Magic Damage equal to 0.8% of the hero's Max HP per second to nearby enemies. This damage is increased by 210% to 350% against creeps and minions (scales with level).

equip.name: Warrior Boots - Conceal
des: Active Skill - Conceal: Success

equip.name: Oracle
des: Unique Passive - Bless: Received Shield and HP Regen effects are increased by 30%.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

equip.name: Dominance Ice
des: Unique Passive - Arctic Cold: Reduce the Attack Speed of nearby enemy heroes to 75% of normal.

equip.name: Guardian Helmet
des: Unique Passive - Recovery: Regenerates 2.5% Max HP per second (reduced to 0.5% Max HP per second over 5s after taking damage).

gear.tips: Khufra should not be the only Tank in the team - It would be better if he absorbs and deals damage at the same time. This set of equipment items provides not only high HP but also chances to kill enemy heroes in the early game with its high Attack and Passive effects. Oracle's Passive can greatly improve the regeneration ability of Khufra. The CD Reduction provided by Oracle and Thunder Belt makes it easier for Khufra to use 1st skill frequently to perform stable control effects for the team. Sky Guardian Helmet and Athena's Shield increase Khufra's survival ability to ensure that he can complete his skill combo in the teamfights.

besty.best_mate_tips: Khufra's Ult "Tyrant's Rage" needs some time to release. Within this duration if his teammates can provide crowd controls, Khufra can make full use of his skills.
besty.name: Vale

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Khufra's 2nd skill "Bouncing Ball" counters those heroes who are fragile and good at blink skills.
counter.name: Fanny

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: If Khufra gets out of the "Bouncing Ball" state, he will be more easier to get killed. So, he is countered by heroes with knock-up effects.
countered_by.name: Saber

skill.name: Rhapsody
skill.des: Granger fills his gun with all bullets and shoots them forward, each bullet dealing 35<font color='#D58E1F'>( +70% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> (120 more damage against creeps).
skill.tips: It's a great combo using this skill to change your position in battle and using "Rhapsody" to deal high damage. As it highly increases the Hit Rate of "Rhapsody" and reduces the CD time of this skill.

skill.name: Rondo
skill.des:
Granger blinks in the designated direction, and his next 2 Basic Attacks deal extra 25% of damage in 5s. 
Each time <font color='#404495'>("Rhapsody")</font> hits an enemy hero, the CD of this skill will be reduced by 0.5s.
skill.tips: Regardless of whether you are in pursuit of an enemy or on the run, take good advantage of this skill to reposition in battle.

skill.name: Death Sonata
skill.des: Granger transforms his violin into a super cannon and fills it with all bullets. He then shoots 2 Super Bullets forward at a time. The Super Bullet ignores Minions along the way and only hits enemy heroes. Super Bullets will explode upon hitting the first enemy hero, dealing 80<font color='#D58E1F'>( +70% Total Physical Attack)</font> + 12% of the enemy's lost HP <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> to enemies nearby and slowing the enemies hit by 80%. Each time Granger shoots a Super Bullet, he can move to another location. When <font color='#404495'>("Death Sonata")</font> ends, the cooldown of this skill will be reduced by 15% for every 2 remaining Super Bullets.
skill.tips: The "lucky" effect of Granger's 6th bullet is not limited to his basic attacks, but also work with his 1st skill and ultimate! Make sure you hit the enemies with the 6th bullet to deal massive damage no matter what!

skill.name: Caprice
skill.des:
Granger can fill his gun with up to 6 bullets at a time. Each 6th bullet deals Critical Damage.
Granger's Basic Attack will deal 50<font color='#D58E1F'>( +110% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>, but he gains 40% Attack Speed from Equipment or Emblems.
skill.tips: Rhapsody is Granger's primary damaging dealing skill. The last bullet of this skill guarantees critical damage. So watch your aim to make sure the last bullet hits the target.

item.tips: Upgrade Skill 1 first. Then upgrade Ult when possible. Save Skill 2 for the last.

equip.name: Hunter Strike
des: Unique Passive - Retribution: Dealing damage to the same enemy hero or creep 5 times in a row grants 50% extra Movement Speed that decays over 3s (8s cooldown).

equip.name: Blade of Despair
des: Unique Passive - Despair: Attacking enemies below 50% HP grants 25% extra Physical Attack for 2s (takes effect before the damage is dealt).

equip.name: Endless Battle
des: Unique Passive - Divine Justice: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 60% Physical Attack as extra True Damage (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Malefic Roar
des: Unique Passive - Armor Buster: When attacking an enemy, gains 0.05% extra Physical Penetration for each point of the enemy's Physical Defense, capped at 20%.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: Since Granger is a hero with DPS skills and his sixth bullet guarantees critical damage, we recommend equipment items which provide Physical ATK, Crit Damage and CD Reduction as a core. Buy Berserker's Fury first for your Builds. The 40% Crit Damage Bonus is perfect for Granger's sixth bullet. Then, according to the actual situation, you can choose between Blade of Despair and Bloodlust Axe. The large amount of Physical Attacks added by Blade of Despair can ensure that Granger can kill the enemies through skill combo, while 20% Spell Vamp of Bloodlust Axe can strengthen his ability in lane. For the last equipment item, you can choose Endless Battle and Hunter Strike, with 40% CD Reduction and increased cast frequency of his skills.

besty.best_mate_tips: Tank heroes with control skills can prevent the enemy from attacking Granger, and they can control the enemy to ensure that Granger's skills are more likely to hit the enemy.
besty.name: Tigreal

counter.restrain_hero_tips: Granger is a hero with high burst. Damage dealers are at risk in front of him.
counter.name: Roger

countered_by.by_restrain_tips: Although Granger has many displacement skills, he will still be countered by some assassins with high burst in short duration.
countered_by.name: Gusion

skill.name: Energy Wave
skill.des:
Guinevere releases an energy orb in the target direction, dealing 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +130% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to the first enemy hit and slowing them by 50% for 1.2s.
Successfully hitting an enemy reduces all her skill cooldowns by 1s.
skill.tips: It's the main damage skill of Guinevere. The strong slowing effects can increase the hit rate of other skills. Meanwhile, this skill provides CD Reduction to other skills. It's also a poke skill when Guinevere is laning.

skill.name: Spatial Migration
skill.des:
Guinevere thumps at the target location for 250<font color='#27C0C7'>( +80% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font>. Enemy Heroes and Creeps hit will be knocked airborne for 1s and take 125<font color='#27C0C7'>( +50% Total Magic Power)</font> additional <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font>.
After cast, Guinevere can reactivate the skill in 5s to blink toward the target direction and leave an illusion behind. If the illusion takes damage, it restores Super Magic for Guinevere and will explode in 1.5s, dealing 100<font color='#27C0C7'>( +30% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to nearby enemies.
skill.tips: As the core skill of Guinevere, How many enemies are knocked into the air determines the success or failure of the teamfights.

skill.name: Violet Requiem
skill.des:
Guinevere creates a force field around her, attacking nearby enemies 11 times within 2s, dealing 650<font color='#27C0C7'>( +500% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> in total.
If the enemy hit is already airborne, they will be knocked airborne again, up to 6 additional times. 
Guinevere is immune to CC while casting this skill.
skill.tips: Other than the knock-up effect of Magic Thump, you can also use this skill to cooperate with teammates' knock-up skills.

skill.name: Super Magic
skill.des:
Guinevere deals 25% extra damage to airborne enemies.
Guinevere deals <font color='#D58E1F'>( +80% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+60% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> with her Basic Attacks and accumulates Super Magic each time she deals damage. When she's fully charged, her next Basic Attack becomes guided, dealing 80<font color='#D58E1F'>( +100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#27C0C7'>(+120% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic damage)</font> on hit and restoring 80 plus 8% of her lost HP.
Enemies hit by Guinevere's enhanced Basic Attack, <font color='#404495'>(Energy Wave)</font>, or <font color='#404495'>(Spatial Migration)</font> are marked for 5s. Those with 3 marks will be knocked airborne when hit by her <font color='#404495'>(Violet Requiem)</font>.
skill.tips: Try to deal damage to enemies while they're knocked up.

item.tips: Build Energy Wave at first because it provides the main damage dealt. Build the Ult when possible.

equip.name: Concentrated Energy
des: Unique Passive - Recharge: Recovers 10% Max HP on hero kills.

equip.name: Calamity Reaper
des: Unique Passive - Calamity: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 120% Magic Power as extra True Damage and grants 10% extra Movement Speed (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Blood Wings
des: Unique Passive - Guard: Gains a shield equal to 200% of Magic Power. The shield will regenerate 30s after being damaged, and grants 40 Movement Speed while it lasts.

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: We recommend the first set of the equipment items. Calamity Reaper can better improve Guinevere's enhanced basic attack. Feather of Heaven helps Guinevere accumulate Super Magic at easier ways. Blood Wings ensures her survival ability after entering the teamfights.

skill.name: Frostmoon Shield
skill.des: Esmeralda gains 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +150% Total Magic Power)</font> Shield and 40% Movement Speed which rapidly decays over its duration for 4s. Meanwhile, she gradually transforms the shields of her nearby enemies into her own shield, capped at 50% of her Max HP.
skill.tips: This skill will last for a while. Since Frostmoon causes damage and also provides shields for enemies, it will deal damage to the enemies continuously. Esmeralda transforms shield from enemies to help herself survive. This skill is the key for Esmeralda to take huge amounts of damage.

skill.name: Stardust Dance
skill.des: Esmeralda waves Stardust and Frostmoon, dealing 240<font color='#D58E1F'>( +60% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> and 300<font color='#27C0C7'>( +120% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> to nearby enemies. Each time she deals damage to a hero, the cooldown of <font color='#404495'>(Frostmoon Shield)</font> is reduced by 1.5s (damaging non-hero units grants a 0.5s reduction) and the enemy's Movement Speed is reduced by 10% for 1.5s.
skill.tips: This is her main damage dealing skill, causing a lot of damage while also reducing the cooldown of Frostmoon Shield. Cast Stardust Dance after Frostmoon Shield and it would be easier to survive.

skill.name: Falling Starmoon
skill.des: Esmeralda coheres the power of Astrospace into her two weapons - Stardust and Frostmoon. The longer the duration lasts, the greater the power will be. Use again: Esmeralda casts the Stardust to the designated location, dealing 350<font color='#D58E1F'>( +90% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>, and then she moves to the designated location to cast Frostmoon, dealing 350<font color='#27C0C7'>( +140% Total Magic Power)</font> <font color='#3B69FF'>(Magic Damage)</font> and immobilizing enemies in the area for 1s.
skill.tips: This skill provides the most important ability to get enrolled in battles, where it will also cause a temporary effect of control on enemies. Choosing the right time to take moves can change the final outcome of a teamfight.

skill.name: Starmoon Casket
skill.des:
Esmeralda manipulates Stardust and Frostmoon, causing her Basic Attacks and skills to deal two instances of damage. Stardust deals Physical Damage while Frostmoon deals Magic Damage and gives the target a shield equal to 135% of Frostmoon's damage dealt.
The damage dealt by Esmeralda ignores all shield effects and gradually converts her shields into HP.
skill.tips: With Passive, Esmeralda deals more damage than any other hero. However, it also provides her enemies with shield effects. Relying on Frostmoon to quickly transform the enemy's shield to herself is the key point of using Esmeralda.

item.tips: Mainly upgrade Stardust Dance because it's her main damage dealing skill. Upgrade the Ultimate when possible.

equip.name: Enchanted Talisman
des: Unique Passive - Mana Spring: Regenerates 15% Max Mana every 10s.

equip.name: Feather of Heaven
des: Unique Passive - Affliction: Basic Attacks deal extra Magic Damage equal to 50 plus 30% of the hero's Magic Power.

equip.name: Calamity Reaper
des: Unique Passive - Calamity: After casting a skill, the next Basic Attack within 3s deals 120% Magic Power as extra True Damage and grants 10% extra Movement Speed (1.5s cooldown).

equip.name: Holy Crystal
des: Unique Passive - Mystery: Gains 21%-35% extra Magic Power (scales with level).

equip.name: Blood Wings
des: Unique Passive - Guard: Gains a shield equal to 200% of Magic Power. The shield will regenerate 30s after being damaged, and grants 40 Movement Speed while it lasts.

gear.tips: We recommend this set of equipment items. Since Esmeralda is both Mage and Tank, it would be better to choose Magical equipment with survival abilities to increase her battle power.

skill.name: Revenge Strike
skill.des: Terizla cracks the ground with his hammer and the fissure will spread out, dealing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +80% Extra Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>. After the fissure hits the first target, it will drill into the target and slow them by 30%. At the same time, Terizla's Movement Speed will be increased by 25% for 3s. The fissure on target will then explode, dealing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +80% Extra Physical Attack)</font> plus 20% of the enemy's lost HP <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>.
skill.tips:
Terizla smashes the ground with his hammer, causing a fissure with cracks that spreads out and deals Physical Damage to enemies in contact with it. The first enemy in contact with the fissure will suffer a loss in Movement Speed, while Terizla gains an increase in Movement Speed. The affected enemy will then suffer an explosion with Physical Damage equal to 10% of the enemy's lost HP.
This is a poke skill as Terizla's Movement Speed increases while the enemy's Movement Speed decreases, enabling Terizla to easily escape or chase the enemy.

skill.name: Execution Strike
skill.des:
Terizla waves his hammer in a fan-shaped area ahead. This skill can be cast up to 3 times. The first two attacks deal 135<font color='#D58E1F'>( +180% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> each, while the third deals 225<font color='#D58E1F'>( +300% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font>. Enemies hit will also be slowed by 20% for 1.25s (the Slowing Effect can stack).
Deals only 60% damage to minions.
skill.tips:
"Terizla swings the hammer in a fan-shaped area, which could be dealt 3 times for Physical Damage. The first 2 times will deal Physical Damage to enemies while the 3rd time will deal increased Physical Damage with a Movement Speed slowing effect. This slowing effect could be stacked.
Execution Strike is Terizla's main offensive skill as it deals tremendous damage to enemies. This skill can be manually controlled to better afflict damage, which could be enhanced when combined with Revenge Strike or Sprint."

skill.name: Penalty Zone
skill.des: Terizla jumps to the designated area to smash down, causing 300<font color='#D58E1F'>( +100% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> and slowing enemies by 45%. Meanwhile, he summons Scaffold, which will reach out a hook to the enemies and pull the target for several times, causing 150<font color='#D58E1F'>( +30% Total Physical Attack)</font> <font color='#C53535'>(Physical Damage)</font> each time.
skill.tips:
"Terizla leaps into a designated area, causing Physical Damage and slowing down enemies caught in the blast. Then, he summons the Guillotine several times to pull enemies in while causing Physical Damage.
This skill could be useful in Team Fights or in solo combat. However, the timing must be carefully measured as it comes with a long cast time. As this skill has a strong control effect, it could be combined with Execution Strike to deal extreme damage. "

skill.name: Body of Smith
skill.des:
Terizla gains 1% extra Damage Reduction (up to 30%) for every 2.5% HP lost.
He cannot gain extra Attack Speed and will convert every 1% extra Attack Speed he's supposed to receive into 1 extra Physical Attack.
skill.tips:
"Terizla's lost HP will be converted to a limited amount of Damage Reduction. His Attack Speed can't be increased. Every 1% increase in Attack Speed will be converted to Physical Attack.
The lower the HP of Terizla, the more damage resistant he becomes. This could enable him to draw fire more effectively in team offensives. "

equip.name: Warrior Boots
des: Unique Passive - Valor: Gains 5 extra Physical Defense for 3s when struck by a Basic Attack, capped at 25.

equip.name: War Axe
des: Unique Passive - Fighting Spirit: Attacks grant 10 extra Physical Attack and 2 extra Physical Penetration for 3s, capped at 8 stacks (the effect is reduced to 3 extra Physical Attack and 1 extra Physical Penetration for Marksmen/Mages/Supports). Gains 15% extra Movement Speed at full stacks.

equip.name: Queen's Wings
des: Unique Passive - Demonize: When HP drops below 40%, gains 20% Damage Reduction and 35% extra Spell Vamp for 5s (60s cooldown).

equip.name: Blade of Despair
des: Unique Passive - Despair: Attacking enemies below 50% HP grants 25% extra Physical Attack for 2s (takes effect before the damage is dealt).

equip.name: Immortality
des: Unique Passive - Immortal: Revives 2.5s after death, gaining 16% Max HP and a 220-1200 shield (scales with level) that lasts 3s (210s cooldown).

gear.tips: Terizla is a tank capable of high bursts. As such, the following are the recommended Equipment Items:
